thread.title: Tennis star Eugenie Bouchard agrees to second date with Twitter fan
thread.title_full: Tennis star Eugenie Bouchard agrees to second date with Twitter fan

title: Tennis star Eugenie Bouchard agrees to second date with Twitter fan
text:
Tennis star Eugenie Bouchard agrees to second date with Twitter fan Last updated 12:04, February 19 2017 
A glamorous tennis star and handsome nobody, brought together by a fairytale sporting comeback and a relationship played out to the world on social media. 
While it sounds like it could be the plot of the latest Richard Curtis film, romance appears to be blooming for real for Eugenie Bouchard and an American university student as they plan a second date. The Canadian tennis star, who models for Sports Illustrated, made a bet with John Goehrke, a 20-year-old student, that the Atlanta Falcons would defeat the New England Patriots in the Super Bowl. 
READ MORE: 
Eugenie Bouchard described John Goehrke as "a very nice boy". 
The Falcons were 21-0 ahead when Bouchard tweeted she was certain Atlanta would win. "If Patriots win [can] we go on a date?" Goehrke tweeted. "Sure," Bouchard fired back. Sure enough, New England pulled off one of the unlikeliest comebacks in Super Bowl history, winning 34-28 in overtime. 
Bouchard honoured the bet and flew Goehrke from Missouri, where he studies, to New York. She secured front row seats for a basketball game on Wednesday evening. The date clearly went well - Bouchard tweeted regular updates to her more than one million followers, including a picture of Goehrke kissing her on the cheek at the end of the evening. 
He followed up with a gift - some earrings from Tiffany's. GETTY IMAGES 
Canadian tennis star Eugenie Bouchard in action on the court. 
On Friday, she described Mr Goehrke as a "gentleman" and said the date was "awesome!" Check my snap for the deets of my date and what gift John gave meüë∏üèº ‚Äî Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 16, 2017 
When asked whether there would be a second date, she replied to the reporter: "For sure!" TWITTER 
John Goehrke and Eugenie Bouchard on the way to their date. 
"I planned the date. He picked me up at my hotel like a gentleman, then we came over here, he brought me a nice little gift and he enjoyed the game courtside," she said. Ad Feedback 
The tennis player, who is currently ranked 44th in the world, admitted that she was "so lucky" Goehrke is "normal". 
Bouchard, who has also reached the semi-finals of the Australian and French Opens, said she had been nervous before the first date. 
"After all the media attention it got, it was something I could, first of all, not back out of. There was no chance," she said. 
"I was worried, however, when I looked at his Twitter profile as soon as I lost the bet and his profile picture was a picture of Tiger Woods. I was like, 'It's one of those Twitter fans. I don't even know what he looks like. What is going to happen?' 
"But it turns out he seems to be a very nice boy." 
The student said it was "amazing" that Bouchard had agreed to the date. 
"The most amazing part is that she agreed to it without knowing who I was," he explained. 
"I thought maybe there was a chance she would respond, but I thought there was no chance she'd actually agree to it." 
It is not the first time celebrities or sports stars have agreed to dates with strangers. Tupac Shakur took a teenager to her prom night after she wrote to him explaining her boyfriend had dumped her. 
In 2011 a US marine made a YouTube video asking Mila Kunis to be his date to the Marine Corps ball - she agreed. 
And a Justin Bieber fan made a website asking him to be her date to her prom night. 
He replied saying his schedule was too packed to be able to make it - but made up for it by inviting her to be his 'plus one' at the Billboard awards. - The Telegraph, London
